summary: In EU legal and regulatory contexts, the term "website," redirected to "Internet site," encompasses various functionalities and interconnections that enhance user experience. Websites serve as interactive portals, allowing users to access databases and information, including scorecards and evaluators' reports. The EU supervises these sites to ensure compliance with privacy regulations, while also investigating any potential malfunctions or unavailability issues. By leveraging technologies, websites can embed functionalities that improve user engagement and facilitate the publishing of essential documents. Moreover, the interconnected nature of domains and registries, such as EURID, plays a crucial role in maintaining an efficient online environment, thereby alleviating barriers to information access.
